```
print(f'Confidence: {confidence}')
else:
print(f'\n⚠ CONCLUSION: Publisher not definitively identified from bibliographic searches')
print('Recommend manual review of date-verified findings or direct library catalog consultation')

print('\n=== FILES CREATED ===')
for file in sorted(os.listdir('workspace')):
if 'martineau_history' in file:
file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file)
file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)
print(f'- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
```
developer
2025-08-13 03:31:07
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 1)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_search(query, search_index): print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis clean_query = query.replace(' ', '_').replace('"', '').replace("'", '').replace('/', '_')[:50] filename = f'robertson_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with novel and illustrator information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Include moderately relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:500], # Extended text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in text_lower has_1839 = '1839' in text_lower has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in text_lower and 'otley' in text_lower has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in text_lower has_scotland = 'scotland' in text_lower has_wales = 'wales' in text_lower has_orphan = 'orphan' in text_lower has_clerk = 'clerk' in text_lower has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in text_lower or 'illustration' in text_lower has_dickens = 'dickens' in text_lower has_rat_match = 'rat match' in text_lower # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles text_lines = link['text'].split('\n') for line in text_lines: line_clean = line.strip() if (('robertson' in line_clean.lower() or 'glasgow' in line_clean.lower()) and len(line_clean) > 15 and len(line_clean) < 200 and any(word in line_clean.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'book'])): novel_title_candidates.add(line_clean) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in text_lower: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'][:300], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["text"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 4: DETAILED ANALYSIS OF HIGH-PRIORITY FINDINGS ===') if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined novel and illustrator scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['score']), reverse=True) print(f'\nAnalyzing {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(high_priority_findings[:10], 1): # Top 10 findings print(f'\n🔍 FINDING {i} - {finding["priority"]} (Novel: {finding["novel_score"]}, Illustrator: {finding["illustrator_score"]}, Rel: {finding["score"]})') print(f'Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f'URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f'Text: {finding["text"][:600]}...') print('-' * 120) # If this is a critical finding, recommend investigation if finding['novel_score'] >= 10 and finding['illustrator_score'] >= 6: print(f' ⭐ HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR INVESTIGATION: {finding["url"]}') else: print('\n⚠ No high-priority findings identified') print('May need to search with different terms or check specific databases') # Try Google Books API for more specific search print(f'\n=== STEP 5: GOOGLE BOOKS API SEARCH ===') google_books_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson 1839 Saunders Otley', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow Scotland Wales 1839', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson orphan clerk' ] books_api_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(google_books_queries, 1): print(f'\n--- Google Books API Query {i}: {query} ---') try: api_url = 'https://www.googleapis.com/books/v1/volumes' params = { 'q': query, 'maxResults': 20, 'printType': 'books' } response = requests.get(api_url, params=params, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() if 'items' in data: print(f'Found {len(data["items"])} books') for book in data['items']: volume_info = book.get('volumeInfo', {}) title = volume_info.get('title', '') authors = volume_info.get('authors', []) published_date = volume_info.get('publishedDate', '') publisher = volume_info.get('publisher', '') description = volume_info.get('description', '') # Check if this matches our criteria title_lower = title.lower() authors_str = ' '.join(authors).lower() desc_lower = description.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() # Look for Robertson brothers' work if (('robertson' in authors_str or 'robertson' in title_lower) and ('1839' in published_date or '1839' in desc_lower or 'saunders' in publisher_lower or 'otley' in publisher_lower or 'glasgow' in desc_lower or 'scotland' in desc_lower)): print(f'\n🎯 POTENTIAL ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL!') print(f'Title: {title}') print(f'Authors: {authors}') print(f'Publisher: {publisher}') print(f'Published: {published_date}') if description: print(f'Description: {description[:400]}...') books_api_results.append({ 'title': title, 'authors': authors, 'publisher': publisher, 'published_date': published_date, 'description': description, 'query': query, 'source': 'Google Books API' }) # Check for illustration mentions if ('illustrated' in desc_lower or 'illustration' in desc_lower or 'plates' in desc_lower or 'engravings' in desc_lower): print(f' 🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATED EDITION!') else: print('No books found in API response') else: print(f'API request failed: {response.status_code}') time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error with Google Books API: {str(e)}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations), 'google_books_results': len(books_api_results) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:10], # Top 10 findings 'google_books_results': books_api_results, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Google Books API returned {len(books_api_results)} relevant results') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') if books_api_results: print(f'\n📖 GOOGLE BOOKS TOP RESULT:') top_book = books_api_results[0] print(f'Title: {top_book["title"]}') print(f'Authors: {top_book["authors"]}') print(f'Publisher: {top_book["publisher"]}') print(f'Date: {top_book["published_date"]}') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains a critical variable definition error and appears to be running completely different functionality than intended. The **CURRENT CODE** is designed to search for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel published by Saunders and Otley, but the output shows it's actually executing a cycling database search for Tour de France cyclists with scores. The error 'name 'search_base_url' is not defined' occurs immediately, and then the code switches to searching for cyclists like Marcel Bidot and Gaston Rebry instead of literary works. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no novel or illustrator research was conducted. The code appears to have incorrect variable definitions and is executing the wrong search logic entirely. Recommended fix: Debug the search_base_url variable definition, ensure the correct search functionality is being executed for literary research rather than cycling data, and verify all variable names are properly defined before use.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_search(query, search_index): print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis clean_query = query.replace(' ', '_').replace('"', '').replace("'", '').replace('/', '_')[:50] filename = f'robertson_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with novel and illustrator information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Include moderately relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:500], # Extended text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in text_lower has_1839 = '1839' in text_lower has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in text_lower and 'otley' in text_lower has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in text_lower has_scotland = 'scotland' in text_lower has_wales = 'wales' in text_lower has_orphan = 'orphan' in text_lower has_clerk = 'clerk' in text_lower has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in text_lower or 'illustration' in text_lower has_dickens = 'dickens' in text_lower has_rat_match = 'rat match' in text_lower # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles text_lines = link['text'].split('\n') for line in text_lines: line_clean = line.strip() if (('robertson' in line_clean.lower() or 'glasgow' in line_clean.lower()) and len(line_clean) > 15 and len(line_clean) < 200 and any(word in line_clean.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'book'])): novel_title_candidates.add(line_clean) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in text_lower: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'][:300], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["text"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 4: DETAILED ANALYSIS OF HIGH-PRIORITY FINDINGS ===') if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined novel and illustrator scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['score']), reverse=True) print(f'\nAnalyzing {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(high_priority_findings[:10], 1): # Top 10 findings print(f'\n🔍 FINDING {i} - {finding["priority"]} (Novel: {finding["novel_score"]}, Illustrator: {finding["illustrator_score"]}, Rel: {finding["score"]})') print(f'Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f'URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f'Text: {finding["text"][:600]}...') print('-' * 120) # If this is a critical finding, recommend investigation if finding['novel_score'] >= 10 and finding['illustrator_score'] >= 6: print(f' ⭐ HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR INVESTIGATION: {finding["url"]}') else: print('\n⚠ No high-priority findings identified') print('May need to search with different terms or check specific databases') # Try Google Books API for more specific search print(f'\n=== STEP 5: GOOGLE BOOKS API SEARCH ===') google_books_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson 1839 Saunders Otley', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow Scotland Wales 1839', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson orphan clerk' ] books_api_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(google_books_queries, 1): print(f'\n--- Google Books API Query {i}: {query} ---') try: api_url = 'https://www.googleapis.com/books/v1/volumes' params = { 'q': query, 'maxResults': 20, 'printType': 'books' } response = requests.get(api_url, params=params, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() if 'items' in data: print(f'Found {len(data["items"])} books') for book in data['items']: volume_info = book.get('volumeInfo', {}) title = volume_info.get('title', '') authors = volume_info.get('authors', []) published_date = volume_info.get('publishedDate', '') publisher = volume_info.get('publisher', '') description = volume_info.get('description', '') # Check if this matches our criteria title_lower = title.lower() authors_str = ' '.join(authors).lower() desc_lower = description.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() # Look for Robertson brothers' work if (('robertson' in authors_str or 'robertson' in title_lower) and ('1839' in published_date or '1839' in desc_lower or 'saunders' in publisher_lower or 'otley' in publisher_lower or 'glasgow' in desc_lower or 'scotland' in desc_lower)): print(f'\n🎯 POTENTIAL ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL!') print(f'Title: {title}') print(f'Authors: {authors}') print(f'Publisher: {publisher}') print(f'Published: {published_date}') if description: print(f'Description: {description[:400]}...') books_api_results.append({ 'title': title, 'authors': authors, 'publisher': publisher, 'published_date': published_date, 'description': description, 'query': query, 'source': 'Google Books API' }) # Check for illustration mentions if ('illustrated' in desc_lower or 'illustration' in desc_lower or 'plates' in desc_lower or 'engravings' in desc_lower): print(f' 🎨 POTENTIAL ILLUSTRATED EDITION!') else: print('No books found in API response') else: print(f'API request failed: {response.status_code}') time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error with Google Books API: {str(e)}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations), 'google_books_results': len(books_api_results) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:10], # Top 10 findings 'google_books_results': books_api_results, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Google Books API returned {len(books_api_results)} relevant results') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') if books_api_results: print(f'\n📖 GOOGLE BOOKS TOP RESULT:') top_book = books_api_results[0] print(f'Title: {top_book["title"]}') print(f'Authors: {top_book["authors"]}') print(f'Publisher: {top_book["publisher"]}') print(f'Date: {top_book["published_date"]}') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')
Execution Output
Code Output: === SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 === Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers) Publisher: Saunders and Otley Year: 1839 Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens) ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL === Total search queries: 10 Search queries: 1. J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel 2. Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales 3. "J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk 4. Robertson "Francia's Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley 5. Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel 6. J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland 7. Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist 8. Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction 9. "Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel 10. Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley === EXECUTING SEARCHES === --- SEARCH 1: J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel --- Error: name 'search_base_url' is not defined Search response: 200 Search results page length: 3606 characters ❌ Error during search for Bidot: name 'link_text' is not defined ❌ No profile found for Marcel Bidot Completed search for Marcel Bidot --- SEARCH 2: Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales --- Error: name 'search_base_url' is not defined --- SEARCH 3: "J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk --- Error: name 'search_base_url' is not defined 🚴 [10/10] Searching for: Gaston Rebry ------------------------------------------------------------ Last name for search: 'Rebry' (cleaned: 'Rebry') Searching with lastName='Rebry' --- SEARCH 4: Robertson "Francia's Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley --- Error: name 'search_base_url' is not defined --- SEARCH 5: Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel --- Error: name 'search_base_url' is not defined Search response: 200 Search results page length: 3620 characters ❌ Error during search for Rebry: name 'link_text' is not defined ❌ No profile found for Gaston Rebry Completed search for Gaston Rebry --- SEARCH 6: J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland --- Error: name 'search_base_url' is not defined --- SEARCH 7: Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist --- Error: name 'search_base_url' is not defined 📊 COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY ======================================== Total search attempts: 13 Successful searches: 13 Cyclist profiles found: 0 Results collected: 0 Target score 3857 found: ❌ ❌ Target score 3857 not found in searched cyclists Remaining cyclists to search: ['André Leducq', 'Antonin Magne', 'Georges Speicher', 'Charles Pélissier', 'Henri Pélissier', 'Francis Pélissier', 'Maurice Archambaud', 'René Vietto', 'Marcel Bidot', 'Gaston Rebry'] 💾 Complete results saved to: workspace_webshaper_74/cyclingranking_systematic_search_20250813_033047.json 🔄 SEARCH INCOMPLETE - Continue with remaining cyclists Methodology validated - proper search form works ✅ SYSTEMATIC CYCLINGRANKING.COM SEARCH COMPLETED! Results and analysis available in workspace for further review.
developer
2025-08-13 03:32:45
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # FIXED: Define search_base_url at the top level search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_search(query, search_index): print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis clean_query = query.replace(' ', '_').replace('"', '').replace("'", '').replace('/', '_')[:50] filename = f'robertson_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with novel and illustrator information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Include moderately relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:500], # Extended text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in text_lower has_1839 = '1839' in text_lower has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in text_lower and 'otley' in text_lower has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in text_lower has_scotland = 'scotland' in text_lower has_wales = 'wales' in text_lower has_orphan = 'orphan' in text_lower has_clerk = 'clerk' in text_lower has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in text_lower or 'illustration' in text_lower has_dickens = 'dickens' in text_lower has_rat_match = 'rat match' in text_lower # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles text_lines = link['text'].split('\n') for line in text_lines: line_clean = line.strip() if (('robertson' in line_clean.lower() or 'glasgow' in line_clean.lower()) and len(line_clean) > 15 and len(line_clean) < 200 and any(word in line_clean.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'book'])): novel_title_candidates.add(line_clean) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in text_lower: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'][:300], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["text"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:10], # Top 10 findings 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')
Execution Output

tester
2025-08-13 03:32:45
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains a critical scope error where 'search_base_url' is defined inside the function but referenced outside of it, causing immediate failure on all 10 search attempts. Additionally, the output shows bizarre mixed content - while the code is supposed to search for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel, the actual execution output contains cycling-related searches for Marcel Bidot, Gaston Rebry, and Tour de France cyclists with scores like 3857. This indicates the code is somehow executing completely different functionality than what's written. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no literary searches were actually performed, no novel identification occurred, and no illustrator research was conducted. The search_base_url variable needs to be moved to the global scope (it's currently defined at line 23 but the error suggests it's not accessible), and there appears to be some kind of code execution mixup where cycling database searches are running instead of the literary research code. Recommended fix: Move search_base_url definition before the perform_search function calls, and investigate why the execution is running cycling searches instead of the Robertson brothers novel research.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL PUBLISHED BY SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # FIXED: Define search_base_url at the top level search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results def perform_search(query, search_index): print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis clean_query = query.replace(' ', '_').replace('"', '').replace("'", '').replace('/', '_')[:50] filename = f'robertson_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with novel and illustrator information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Include moderately relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:500], # Extended text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in text_lower has_1839 = '1839' in text_lower has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in text_lower and 'otley' in text_lower has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in text_lower has_scotland = 'scotland' in text_lower has_wales = 'wales' in text_lower has_orphan = 'orphan' in text_lower has_clerk = 'clerk' in text_lower has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in text_lower or 'illustration' in text_lower has_dickens = 'dickens' in text_lower has_rat_match = 'rat match' in text_lower # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles text_lines = link['text'].split('\n') for line in text_lines: line_clean = line.strip() if (('robertson' in line_clean.lower() or 'glasgow' in line_clean.lower()) and len(line_clean) > 15 and len(line_clean) < 200 and any(word in line_clean.lower() for word in ['novel', 'story', 'tale', 'book'])): novel_title_candidates.add(line_clean) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in text_lower: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'][:300], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["text"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:10], # Top 10 findings 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')
Execution Output
