tester
2025-08-13 03:41:24
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains a critical variable definition error where 'href_lower' is referenced but never properly defined, causing all 10 searches to fail with 'name 'href_lower' is not defined'. Although DDGS successfully retrieved 15 results per search, the analysis crashes during relevance scoring when attempting to evaluate URL domains. The error occurs because the line defining 'href_lower = href.lower()' is missing or incorrectly placed before its usage in the domain scoring section. Additionally, the output shows confusing mixed content with cycling-related searches appearing alongside the novel search attempts, suggesting potential execution environment issues. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no novel identification occurred, no illustrator research was conducted, and no analysis of Robertson brothers' 1839 Saunders and Otley publication was completed despite having search results available. The search strategy and DDGS implementation are fundamentally correct, but this simple variable scoping bug prevents any meaningful analysis. Recommended fix: Ensure 'href_lower = href.lower()' is properly defined immediately after the 'if href:' condition and before any domain scoring logic that references href_lower. Once this variable definition is corrected, the comprehensive Robertson brothers novel search should execute successfully and provide the intended literary analysis.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains (only if href exists and is not empty) if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')
Execution Output
Code Output: === SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 === Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers) Publisher: Saunders and Otley Year: 1839 Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens) ==================================================================================================== === STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL === Total search queries: 10 Search queries: 1. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland 7. Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist 8. Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction 9. "Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel 10. Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley === EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS === --- SEARCH 1: J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel --- [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_webshaper_74 [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_webshaper_75 Found 15 results Error: name 'href_lower' is not defined --- SEARCH 7: Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist --- Found 15 results Error: name 'href_lower' is not defined --- SEARCH 8: Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction --- Found 15 results Error: name 'href_lower' is not defined --- SEARCH 9: "Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel --- Found 15 results Error: name 'href_lower' is not defined --- SEARCH 10: Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley --- Found 15 results Error: name 'href_lower' is not defined === STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION === Successful searches: 0/10 --- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS --- Query: "J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland" Relevant results: 0 Query: "Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist" Relevant results: 0 Query: "Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction" Relevant results: 0 Query: ""Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel" Relevant results: 0 Query: "Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley" Relevant results: 0 === STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS === High-priority findings: 0 Novel title candidates: 0 Illustrator mentions: 0 Publisher confirmations: 0 *** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE *** ✓ Conducted 0 successful searches ✓ Analyzed 0 relevant results ✓ Found 0 high-priority findings ✓ Identified 0 potential novel titles ✓ Found 0 illustrator mentions ✓ Found 0 publisher confirmations ✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: workspace_webshaper_76/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json === NEXT STEPS === 1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification 2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results 3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications 4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" 5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators 6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings

2025-08-13 03:44:45
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # FIXED: Additional scoring for URL domains with proper variable definition if href: # Only process if href exists and is not empty try: href_lower = href.lower() # Define variable here before use if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 except Exception as url_error: print(f' URL processing error: {url_error}') # Continue without URL scoring if there's an issue # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains a persistent variable definition error where 'href_lower' is referenced but never properly defined, causing all 10 searches to fail with 'name 'href_lower' is not defined'. Despite DDGS successfully finding 15 results per search, the analysis crashes during URL domain scoring. The output also shows confusing mixed content with cycling-related searches (Henri Pélissier, Maurice Archambaud, etc.) appearing alongside the Robertson brothers novel searches, indicating serious execution environment issues where the wrong code is running. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no novel identification, no illustrator research, and no analysis of the Robertson brothers' 1839 Saunders and Otley publication was completed. The variable 'href_lower = href.lower()' line appears to be missing or incorrectly placed in the code structure. Recommended fix: Add the missing variable definition 'href_lower = href.lower()' immediately after the 'if href:' condition and before the domain scoring logic. Additionally, investigate why cycling-related searches are appearing in the output when the code should only be executing Robertson brothers novel searches. Save the detailed output to 'workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt' for troubleshooting the execution environment issues.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # FIXED: Additional scoring for URL domains with proper variable definition if href: # Only process if href exists and is not empty try: href_lower = href.lower() # Define variable here before use if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 except Exception as url_error: print(f' URL processing error: {url_error}') # Continue without URL scoring if there's an issue # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')
Execution Output

It is highly likely that ... 📊 FINAL FIXED SEARCH SUMMARY =================================== Total searches: 10 Successful searches: 10 Profiles found: 10 Results collected: 0 Target score 3857 found: ❌ ❌ Target score 3857 not found in searched cyclists Remaining cyclists to search: ['André Leducq', 'Antonin Magne', 'Georges Speicher', 'Charles Pélissier', 'Henri Pélissier', 'Francis Pélissier', 'Maurice Archambaud', 'René Vietto', 'Marcel Bidot', 'Gaston Rebry'] 💾 Complete results saved to: workspace_webshaper_74/cyclingranking_fixed_search_20250813_034339.json 🔄 SEARCH STATUS: Variable scoping bug definitively fixed Profile access now functional - continue searching if needed ✅ FIXED CYCLINGRANKING.COM SEARCH COMPLETED! developer
2025-08-13 03:47:47
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 7)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains - FIXED with proper variable scope if href and href.strip(): # Check href exists and is not empty domain_lower = href.lower() # Use different variable name to avoid conflicts if any(domain in domain_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in domain_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in domain_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings') # Create debug log to help troubleshoot execution environment issues debug_log = f'''ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH DEBUG LOG =========================================== Timestamp: {time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} Search objective: Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839 Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)} Successful searches: {successful_searches} Total relevant results found: {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)} Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)} Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)} Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)} Variable scoping fix applied: Used 'domain_lower' instead of 'href_lower' Execution environment: Clean DDGS implementation No cycling-related searches should appear in this log ''' with open('workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(debug_log) print('\n✓ Debug log saved to: workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt')

tester
2025-08-13 03:47:48
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains a critical variable definition error where 'href_lower' is referenced but never properly defined, causing all searches to fail with 'name 'href_lower' is not defined'. Although DDGS successfully found 15 results per search, the analysis crashes during URL domain scoring when trying to evaluate website domains. The output also shows confusing mixed content with cycling-related searches appearing alongside the Robertson brothers novel searches, indicating serious execution environment contamination. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no novel identification was achieved, no illustrator research was conducted, and no analysis of the Robertson brothers' 1839 Saunders and Otley publication was completed despite having search results available. The variable scoping issue persists because 'href_lower = href.lower()' is still not properly defined before its usage in the domain scoring logic. Recommended fix: Completely rewrite the URL processing section to properly define 'href_lower = href.lower()' immediately after the 'if href:' condition and before any domain scoring operations. Also investigate why cycling-related content is contaminating the Robertson brothers novel search output. Save the comprehensive analysis results to 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_search_results.json' once the variable definition is corrected.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains - FIXED with proper variable scope if href and href.strip(): # Check href exists and is not empty domain_lower = href.lower() # Use different variable name to avoid conflicts if any(domain in domain_lower for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in domain_lower for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 elif any(domain in domain_lower for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_1839_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings') # Create debug log to help troubleshoot execution environment issues debug_log = f'''ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH DEBUG LOG =========================================== Timestamp: {time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} Search objective: Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839 Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)} Successful searches: {successful_searches} Total relevant results found: {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)} Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)} Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)} Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)} Variable scoping fix applied: Used 'domain_lower' instead of 'href_lower' Execution environment: Clean DDGS implementation No cycling-related searches should appear in this log ''' with open('workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(debug_log) print('\n✓ Debug log saved to: workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt')
