Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 8)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # FIXED: URL domain scoring with proper variable definition and error handling if href and isinstance(href, str) and len(href.strip()) > 0: try: url_text = href.lower().strip() # Clean variable definition # Check for high-value academic and archive domains if any(domain in url_text for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 print(f' 📚 Archive domain bonus: +3') elif any(domain in url_text for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📖 Reference domain bonus: +2') elif any(domain in url_text for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📗 Book domain bonus: +2') except Exception as url_error: print(f' ⚠ URL processing error (continuing): {url_error}') # Continue without URL scoring if there's an issue # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_search_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')

Execution failed - The code contains a persistent variable definition error where 'domain_lower' is referenced but never properly defined, causing all 10 searches to fail with 'name 'domain_lower' is not defined'. Despite DDGS successfully finding 15 results per search, the analysis crashes during URL domain scoring when attempting to evaluate website domains for relevance bonuses. The output also shows severe execution environment contamination with cycling-related searches (Maurice Archambaud, cyclist profiles, BeautifulSoup errors) appearing alongside the Robertson brothers novel searches, indicating the wrong code is executing or there are serious environment conflicts. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no novel identification occurred, no illustrator research was conducted, and no analysis of the Robertson brothers' 1839 Saunders and Otley publication was completed despite having search results available from DDGS. The variable 'domain_lower = href.lower()' line is missing or incorrectly placed in the URL processing section around line 125. Recommended fix: Add the missing variable definition 'domain_lower = href.lower()' immediately after the 'if href and href.strip():' condition and before the domain scoring logic that references domain_lower. Additionally, investigate and resolve the execution environment contamination that's causing cycling searches to appear in a Robertson brothers novel search. Save the detailed output to 'workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt' for troubleshooting these execution environment issues.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== SEARCHING FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # FIXED: URL domain scoring with proper variable definition and error handling if href and isinstance(href, str) and len(href.strip()) > 0: try: url_text = href.lower().strip() # Clean variable definition # Check for high-value academic and archive domains if any(domain in url_text for domain in ['archive.org', 'gutenberg.org', 'hathitrust.org']): relevance_score += 3 print(f' 📚 Archive domain bonus: +3') elif any(domain in url_text for domain in ['wikipedia.org', 'britannica.com', 'jstor.org']): relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📖 Reference domain bonus: +2') elif any(domain in url_text for domain in ['abebooks.com', 'biblio.com', 'worldcat.org']): relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📗 Book domain bonus: +2') except Exception as url_error: print(f' ⚠ URL processing error (continuing): {url_error}') # Continue without URL scoring if there's an issue # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_search_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings')
Execution Output

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 9)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== CLEAN ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # URL domain scoring - SIMPLIFIED to avoid variable definition issues if href and len(href) > 0: href_text = str(href).lower() if 'archive.org' in href_text or 'gutenberg.org' in href_text or 'hathitrust.org' in href_text: relevance_score += 3 print(f' 📚 Archive domain bonus: +3') elif 'wikipedia.org' in href_text or 'britannica.com' in href_text or 'jstor.org' in href_text: relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📖 Reference domain bonus: +2') elif 'abebooks.com' in href_text or 'biblio.com' in href_text or 'worldcat.org' in href_text: relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📗 Book domain bonus: +2') # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_search_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings') # Create debug log to help troubleshoot execution environment issues debug_log = f'''ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH DEBUG LOG =========================================== Timestamp: {time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} Search objective: Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839 Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)} Successful searches: {successful_searches} Total relevant results found: {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)} Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)} Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)} Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)} Variable scoping fix applied: Simplified URL processing to avoid variable definition issues Execution environment: Clean DDGS implementation with simplified variable handling No cycling-related searches should appear in this log ''' with open('workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(debug_log) print('\n✓ Debug log saved to: workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code contains a critical variable definition error where 'url_text' is referenced but never properly defined, causing all searches to fail with 'name 'url_text' is not defined'. Although DDGS successfully found 15 results per search and identified relevant Saunders and Otley content, the analysis crashes during URL domain scoring when trying to evaluate website domains for academic/archive bonuses. The output shows severe execution environment contamination with cycling-related searches (René Vietto, Marcel Bidot, cyclist profiles) appearing alongside the Robertson brothers novel searches, indicating the wrong code is executing or there are serious environment conflicts. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no novel identification was achieved, no illustrator research was conducted, and no analysis of the Robertson brothers' 1839 Saunders and Otley publication was completed despite having relevant search results available (Saunders and Otley Orlando entry, Monthly Review 1839, Historical Novels database). The variable scoping issue persists because the line 'url_text = href.lower().strip()' is defined but then referenced incorrectly in the domain scoring logic. Recommended fix: Completely rewrite the URL processing section to use a simpler approach without variable conflicts, and investigate why cycling-related content is contaminating the Robertson brothers novel search output. Save the comprehensive analysis results to 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_search_results.json' once the variable definition and execution environment issues are resolved.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== CLEAN ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # URL domain scoring - SIMPLIFIED to avoid variable definition issues if href and len(href) > 0: href_text = str(href).lower() if 'archive.org' in href_text or 'gutenberg.org' in href_text or 'hathitrust.org' in href_text: relevance_score += 3 print(f' 📚 Archive domain bonus: +3') elif 'wikipedia.org' in href_text or 'britannica.com' in href_text or 'jstor.org' in href_text: relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📖 Reference domain bonus: +2') elif 'abebooks.com' in href_text or 'biblio.com' in href_text or 'worldcat.org' in href_text: relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📗 Book domain bonus: +2') # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_search_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings') # Create debug log to help troubleshoot execution environment issues debug_log = f'''ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH DEBUG LOG =========================================== Timestamp: {time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} Search objective: Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839 Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)} Successful searches: {successful_searches} Total relevant results found: {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)} Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)} Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)} Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)} Variable scoping fix applied: Simplified URL processing to avoid variable definition issues Execution environment: Clean DDGS implementation with simplified variable handling No cycling-related searches should appear in this log ''' with open('workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(debug_log) print('\n✓ Debug log saved to: workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt')

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 10)

Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time print('=== ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH: SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 ===') print('Authors: J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson (Robertson brothers)') print('Publisher: Saunders and Otley') print('Year: 1839') print('Setting: Rural Scotland and Wales') print('Character: Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow') print('Objective: Identify the novel and its illustrator (who worked with Dickens)') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for Robertson brothers' 1839 novel search_queries = [ 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Saunders Otley 1839 novel', 'Robertson brothers Saunders and Otley 1839 Scotland Wales', '"J.P. Robertson" "W.P. Robertson" 1839 Glasgow orphan clerk', 'Robertson "Francia\'s Reign of Terror" authors 1839 novel Saunders Otley', 'Saunders and Otley 1839 Robertson brothers Scotland Wales novel', 'J.P. Robertson W.P. Robertson Glasgow orphan clerk rural Scotland', 'Robertson brothers 1839 novel illustrated Dickens artist', 'Saunders Otley publishers 1839 Robertson Scotland Wales fiction', '"Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel', 'Robertson brothers Glasgow clerk Scotland Wales 1839 Saunders Otley' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') # Initialize search results storage search_results = {} high_priority_findings = [] novel_title_candidates = set() illustrator_mentions = {} publisher_confirmations = [] # Known Victorian illustrators who worked with Dickens known_dickens_illustrators = [ 'Phiz', 'Hablot Browne', 'Hablot Knight Browne', 'George Cruikshank', 'Robert Seymour', 'Marcus Stone', 'Luke Fildes', 'Fred Barnard', 'Sol Eytinge' ] print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES USING DDGS ===\n') # Perform searches using DDGS successful_searches = 0 searcher = DDGS(timeout=10) for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Perform search with multiple backends results = searcher.text(query, max_results=15, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "yandex", "brave"], safesearch="off", region="en-us") if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Analyze each result relevant_results = [] for result in results: title = result.get('title', '') body = result.get('body', '') href = result.get('href', '') # Combine title and body for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}".lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for Robertson brothers novel identification high_value_terms = [ ('robertson', 3), ('j.p. robertson', 4), ('w.p. robertson', 4), ('1839', 4), ('saunders', 3), ('otley', 3), ('saunders and otley', 4), ('glasgow', 3), ('scotland', 2), ('wales', 2), ('orphan', 3), ('clerk', 2), ('novel', 2), ('fiction', 2), ('brothers', 2), ('illustrated', 3), ('illustration', 3), ('dickens', 3), ('artist', 2), ('illustrator', 3) ] # Publisher and illustrator specific terms publisher_illustrator_terms = [ ('phiz', 4), ('hablot browne', 4), ('george cruikshank', 4), ('rat match', 4), ('great 100 rat match', 5), ('1858', 2), ('francia', 2), ('reign of terror', 3) ] # Calculate relevance score from text content for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_illustrator_terms: if term in full_text: relevance_score += score # URL domain scoring - COMPLETELY SIMPLIFIED to avoid any variable issues if href: # Direct string checks without variable assignments if 'archive.org' in str(href) or 'gutenberg.org' in str(href) or 'hathitrust.org' in str(href): relevance_score += 3 print(f' 📚 Archive domain bonus: +3') elif 'wikipedia.org' in str(href) or 'britannica.com' in str(href) or 'jstor.org' in str(href): relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📖 Reference domain bonus: +2') elif 'abebooks.com' in str(href) or 'biblio.com' in str(href) or 'worldcat.org' in str(href): relevance_score += 2 print(f' 📗 Book domain bonus: +2') # Include results with moderate relevance if relevance_score >= 4: relevant_results.append({ 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': href, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'full_text': full_text }) # Sort by relevance score relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'total_results': len(results), 'relevant_results': relevant_results, 'relevant_count': len(relevant_results) } print(f'Relevant results: {len(relevant_results)}') if relevant_results: print('Top results:') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' Body: {result["body"][:150]}...') successful_searches += 1 else: print('No results found') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0 } time.sleep(1) # Rate limiting except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') search_results[query] = { 'total_results': 0, 'relevant_results': [], 'relevant_count': 0, 'error': str(e) } print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR IDENTIFICATION ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant results: {results["relevant_count"]}') for result in results['relevant_results']: full_text = result['full_text'] # Check for key novel identification indicators has_robertson = 'robertson' in full_text has_1839 = '1839' in full_text has_saunders_otley = 'saunders' in full_text and 'otley' in full_text has_glasgow = 'glasgow' in full_text has_scotland = 'scotland' in full_text has_wales = 'wales' in full_text has_orphan = 'orphan' in full_text has_clerk = 'clerk' in full_text has_illustrated = 'illustrated' in full_text or 'illustration' in full_text has_dickens = 'dickens' in full_text has_rat_match = 'rat match' in full_text # Calculate novel identification score novel_score = sum([has_robertson*3, has_1839*4, has_saunders_otley*4, has_glasgow*3, has_scotland*2, has_wales*2, has_orphan*3, has_clerk*2]) # Calculate illustrator identification score illustrator_score = sum([has_illustrated*3, has_dickens*3, has_rat_match*4]) if novel_score >= 8 or illustrator_score >= 6: # High relevance priority = 'HIGH' if novel_score >= 12 and illustrator_score >= 6: priority = 'CRITICAL - Novel + Illustrator Match' elif novel_score >= 12: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Novel Match' elif illustrator_score >= 8: priority = 'HIGH - Strong Illustrator Match' print(f' 🎯 {priority}: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score}') print(f' Robertson: {has_robertson}, 1839: {has_1839}, S&O: {has_saunders_otley}') print(f' Glasgow: {has_glasgow}, Scotland: {has_scotland}, Wales: {has_wales}') print(f' Orphan: {has_orphan}, Clerk: {has_clerk}') print(f' Illustrated: {has_illustrated}, Dickens: {has_dickens}, Rat Match: {has_rat_match}') print(f' Title: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'], 'url': result['url'], 'relevance_score': result['relevance_score'], 'novel_score': novel_score, 'illustrator_score': illustrator_score, 'priority': priority }) # Extract potential novel titles title_text = result['title'] if (('robertson' in title_text.lower() or 'glasgow' in title_text.lower()) and len(title_text) > 10 and len(title_text) < 200): novel_title_candidates.add(title_text) # Check for illustrator mentions for illustrator in known_dickens_illustrators: if illustrator.lower() in full_text: illustrator_mentions[illustrator] = illustrator_mentions.get(illustrator, 0) + 1 print(f' 🎨 ILLUSTRATOR: {illustrator}') # Check for publisher confirmation if has_saunders_otley and has_1839: publisher_confirmations.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result['title'], 'body': result['body'][:300], 'url': result['url'], 'score': result['relevance_score'] }) print(f' 📚 PUBLISHER CONFIRMED: Saunders and Otley 1839') elif novel_score >= 4 or illustrator_score >= 3: # Medium relevance print(f' 📍 MEDIUM: Novel score {novel_score}, Illustrator score {illustrator_score} - {result["title"]}') print(f'\n=== STEP 3: NOVEL AND ILLUSTRATOR ANALYSIS ===') print(f'High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)}') print(f'Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)}') print(f'Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)}') print(f'Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)}') if novel_title_candidates: print('\n📖 POTENTIAL NOVEL TITLES:') for i, title in enumerate(sorted(novel_title_candidates), 1): print(f' {i}. {title}') if illustrator_mentions: print('\n🎨 ILLUSTRATOR FREQUENCY:') sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for illustrator, count in sorted_illustrators: print(f' {illustrator}: {count} mentions') # Provide context for each illustrator if illustrator.lower() in ['phiz', 'hablot browne', 'hablot knight browne']: print(f' - Known for: Dickens illustrations, Pickwick Papers, David Copperfield') elif illustrator.lower() == 'george cruikshank': print(f' - Known for: Oliver Twist illustrations, satirical prints') elif illustrator.lower() == 'robert seymour': print(f' - Known for: Early Pickwick Papers illustrations') if publisher_confirmations: print('\n📚 SAUNDERS AND OTLEY 1839 CONFIRMATIONS:') for i, conf in enumerate(publisher_confirmations, 1): print(f' {i}. Score {conf["score"]}: {conf["title"]}') print(f' Body: {conf["body"][:200]}...') print(f' URL: {conf["url"]}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839', 'target_details': { 'authors': 'J.P. Robertson and W.P. Robertson', 'publisher': 'Saunders and Otley', 'year': '1839', 'setting': 'Rural Scotland and Wales', 'character': 'Young orphan clerk residing in Glasgow', 'illustrator_clue': 'Artist who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match" circa 1858' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_results': sum(r['relevant_count'] for r in search_results.values()) }, 'analysis_results': { 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'novel_title_candidates': list(novel_title_candidates), 'illustrator_mentions': illustrator_mentions, 'publisher_confirmations_count': len(publisher_confirmations) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings, 'publisher_confirmations': publisher_confirmations, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/robertson_brothers_novel_search_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'✓ Conducted {successful_searches} successful searches') print(f'✓ Analyzed {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'✓ Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'✓ Identified {len(novel_title_candidates)} potential novel titles') print(f'✓ Found {len(illustrator_mentions)} illustrator mentions') print(f'✓ Found {len(publisher_confirmations)} publisher confirmations') print(f'✓ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: # Sort by combined scores high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (x['novel_score'] + x['illustrator_score'], x['relevance_score']), reverse=True) top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\n🎯 MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Novel Score: {top_finding["novel_score"]}') print(f'Illustrator Score: {top_finding["illustrator_score"]}') print(f'Relevance Score: {top_finding["relevance_score"]}') print(f'Title: {top_finding["title"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') if illustrator_mentions: sorted_illustrators = sorted(illustrator_mentions.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) top_illustrator = sorted_illustrators[0][0] print(f'\n🎨 MOST MENTIONED ILLUSTRATOR: {top_illustrator} ({sorted_illustrators[0][1]} mentions)') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS ===') print('1. Review high-priority findings for novel title identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Cross-reference with library catalogs for Saunders and Otley 1839 publications') print('4. Research illustrators who worked with Dickens and created "Great 100 Rat Match"') print('5. Look for connections between Robertson brothers and specific illustrators') print('6. Check for novels featuring Glasgow orphan clerks in rural Scotland/Wales settings') # Create debug log to help troubleshoot execution environment issues debug_log = f'''ROBERTSON BROTHERS NOVEL SEARCH DEBUG LOG =========================================== Timestamp: {time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')} Search objective: Find Robertson brothers novel published by Saunders and Otley 1839 Total queries executed: {len(search_queries)} Successful searches: {successful_searches} Total relevant results found: {sum(r["relevant_count"] for r in search_results.values())} High-priority findings: {len(high_priority_findings)} Novel title candidates: {len(novel_title_candidates)} Illustrator mentions: {len(illustrator_mentions)} Publisher confirmations: {len(publisher_confirmations)} Variable scoping fix applied: Completely simplified URL processing with direct string operations Execution environment: Clean DDGS implementation with no variable assignments in URL processing No cycling-related searches should appear in this log ''' with open('workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(debug_log) print('\n✓ Debug log saved to: workspace/robertson_search_debug_log.txt')

First Edition.... --- SEARCH 9: "Great 100 Rat Match" illustration 1858 Dickens artist Robertson novel --- [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_webshaper_74
